aboutText: Experience true Bedouin hospitality in the heart of Wadi Rum. Comfortable tents, traditional food, jeep tours, and unforgettable desert nights.
aboutParagraphs: Wadi Rum, also called the Valley of the Moon, is a spectacular desert destination in southern Jordan, located about 70 km north of Aqaba.

Wadi Rum is famous for its high mountains and pink sand. In fact, it is as famous as Petra, one of the Seven Wonders of the World. It is a popular destination for travelers who are inspired by nature and want to explore its unique desert beauty.

As a protected desert wilderness in southern Jordan, Wadi Rum is home to towering sandstone massifs such as Jebel Um Ishrin, striking natural arches like Burdah Rock Bridge, and ancient inscriptions carved into canyons and caves, including Khazali Canyon. Lawrence’s Spring, a natural water source linked to Lawrence of Arabia, remains one of the area’s most iconic stops.
We offer a wide range of accommodation options in the Wadi Rum desert, designed to provide comfort while preserving the authentic Bedouin experience.
Our guests remember their stay at our camp for a long time. Join hundreds of satisfied visitors from around the world.

tourJeepDesc: Starting from Wadi Rum village at 10AM, explore Lawrence of Arabia's Spring, Khazali Canyon with ancient Nabatean inscriptions, and climb golden sand dunes. Visit Lawrence's House, trek through Mahama Canyon, and enjoy a traditional lunch under the shade. In the afternoon, discover Mushroom Rock, Jebel Burdah Arch, and Um Fruth Arch (climb 20m high for stunning views). Watch the sunset over Red Sand dunes before reaching camp at dusk. Enjoy traditional dinner, music, and bedouin tea by the fire. Sleep in a tent or under the stars watching the Milky Way. After breakfast on day 2, return to the village (optional 2-hour camel trek available for 25 JOD).

tourJeepHalfNightDesc: Begin in Rum village and visit the Nabatean temple, Lawrence’s Spring, and the golden Sand Dunes. Continue to the Little Bridge, then Lawrence’s House with its balancing rocks, and Khazali Canyon to see ancient Nabatean inscriptions. Stop for the golden sunset, return to camp for traditional dinner, music, and tea, and sleep in a tent or under the stars. After breakfast, return to the village (optional 2-hour camel trek back for 25 JOD per camel).

tourJeepShortDesc: Start from Rum village and discover the desert's natural and unique attractions. Visit the Nabatean temple, then Lawrence's Spring to see the fresh water reserve surrounded by mountains. Continue to the Little Bridge for a short hike to enjoy the view, followed by the golden Sand Dunes where you can climb to the top. Explore Khazali Canyon, famous for beautiful ancient Nabatean inscriptions. Stop for the golden sunset before returning to camp for traditional dinner, music, and dancing by the fire. Sleep in a tent or under millions of stars. After breakfast the next day, return to the village (optional 2-hour camel trek for 20 JOD per camel).

Feel the gentle sway of the camel as you traverse the timeless desert landscape, creating unforgettable memories in one of the world's most spectacular natural environments. tourHikingTitle: Jabal Umm Addamy Hiking & One Night
tourHikingDesc: Jabal Umm Addamy is the highest mountain in Jordan at 1832m above sea level, located at the border with Saudi Arabia. From the summit, witness breathtaking views of Saudi Arabia on one side and the vast Wadi Rum desert on the other. This adventure begins in Rum village (1000m elevation) with a magnificent 40km drive south through the far valleys of Wadi Rum, crossing the beautiful and lonely Wadi Saabit. Experience a guided 2.5-hour hike to the summit, followed by a traditional lunch and rest period. After lunch, visit the Rock Bridge in the White Area and Elqettar Spring before returning to camp to witness the golden sunset over the dunes. Enjoy a traditional dinner by the fire with music under the stars, then sleep in a tent or under the open sky. Next morning after breakfast, return to Rum village by jeep, or upgrade to a 2-hour camel trek (additional 25 JOD per camel).
tourHikingIncludes: Drive back to Wadi Rum village
tourHikingExcluded: Optional camel trek (25 JOD per camel)
tourHikingHighlights: Panoramic views of Saudi Arabia & Wadi Rum
40km scenic desert drive through Wadi Saabit
tourHikingBurdahDesc: The tour starts from Rum Village. We drive you to the base of Burdah Mountain, where a guided hike of about 3 hours takes you to the biggest arch in the Wadi Rum desert. We provide all necessary equipment, and our hiking guide will be with you every step of the way. A small portion involves scramble climbing just before and after the arch. The views are breathtaking and the hike is very exciting. On the descent, we stop for lunch in a shaded spot. Then we continue by jeep to Um Frouth Rock Bridge and the Little Bridge, both of which you can climb for the view. On the way back to camp, we stop at Khazaly Canyon to see ancient inscriptions. Back at camp, enjoy a traditional dinner, music by the fire, and stargazing before sleeping in a tent or under the stars.
